metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1283 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
In Apache httpd 2.4.0 to 2.4.29, when mod_session is configured to forwardits session data to CGI applications (SessionEnv on, not the default), aremote user may influence their content by using a "Session" header. Thiscomes from the "HTTP_SESSION" variable name used by mod_session to forwardits data to CGIs, since the prefix "HTTP_" is also used by the Apache HTTPServer to pass HTTP header fields, per CGI specifications.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache2 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8').
